greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f.: Sum_{n>=0} x^n / (1+x)^(2*n+1) * [Sum_{k=0..n} C(n,k)^2 * x^k] * [Sum_{k=0..n} C(n,k)^2 * (-x)^k].
comment: The signs of the terms form a seemingly unpredictable pattern.
The sequence begins [1, 0, -1, 0, -11, 0, 59, 0, ...]. As is standard practice in the database, the zeros have been omitted.
Even order terms of the sequence (i.e., the nonzero ones) gives the diagonal of rational function 1/(1 - (x + y + x*z - y*z - x*y*z)). - _Gheorghe Coserea_, Aug 29 2018
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..300
formula: a(n) = hypergeom([-n, -n, n + 1, n + 1], [1/2, 1, 1], -1/4). - _Peter Luschny_, Mar 14 2018
example: where the g.f. is given by the series:
in which the coefficients of the odd powers of x vanish.
We can also express the g.f. by the series:
mathematica: a[n_] := HypergeometricPFQ[{-n, -n, n + 1, n + 1}, {1/2, 1, 1}, -1/4];Table[a[n], {n, 0, 22}] (* _Peter Luschny_, Mar 14 2018 *)
program: {a(n)=local(A=1); A=sum(m=0, n, x^m/(1+x)^(2*m+1) * sum(k=0, m, binomial(m, k)^2 * x^k) * sum(k=0, m, binomial(m, k)^2 * (-x)^k) +x*O(x^n)); polcoeff(A, n)}
{a(n)=polcoeff(sum(m=0, n, (-x)^m*sum(k=0, m, (-1)^k * binomial(m, k)^2 * sum(j=0, k, binomial(k, j)^2 * x^j) +x*O(x^n))), n)}
{a(n)=sum(k=0, n\2, sum(j=0, n-2*k, (-1)^j * binomial(n-k, k+j)^2 * binomial(k+j, j)^2 ))}
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Nov 07 2014
